subject: Law
title: The Constitution and Federalism
description: A quick win: understand The Constitution and Federalism.

hook.text: Thirteen colonies needed one government but feared tyranny. Their answer: split power between state and federal levels.

buildup.text: The US Constitution (1787) created a federal system dividing power between a national government and the states.

discovery.text: Enumerated powers go to the federal government. Reserved powers stay with the states. The Tenth Amendment says so.

twist.text: Federal power has grown enormously since 1787. The Commerce Clause became a gateway to vast federal regulation.

climax.text: Federalism creates tension: states legalize cannabis while federal law bans it. Both are technically correct.

punchline.text: One nation, two levels of law. Federalism is the balance beam.

quiz.question: What does the Tenth Amendment reserve to the states?
options: Powers not delegated to the federal government
